content:
Diagnosis:		Merkel cell carcinoma right forearm

Management:		12 Jan 2024 Wide local excision and axillary node dissection
			02 Feb 2024 Started adjuvant immunotherapy with Avelumab

Histology:		Merkel cell carcinoma pT2N1M0, MCPyV positive, clear margins
			2/15 axillary nodes positive, no extracapsular extension

Current situation:	Pre-cycle 4 Avelumab

[redacted name] attended for review prior to cycle 4 immunotherapy. Treatment has been well tolerated with only grade 1 fatigue. No immune-related adverse events noted. Surgical site has healed well with good cosmetic outcome. No clinical evidence of local recurrence or new nodal disease. Recent CT chest/abdomen/pelvis (15/4/24) shows no evidence of distant metastases. Blood tests today show stable biochemistry and adequate haematological parameters for treatment continuation. Performance status remains 0.

Plan is to proceed with cycle 4 Avelumab today. Will arrange repeat imaging after cycle 6. Next review in 2 weeks prior to cycle 5.

primary_cancer.histopathology_status: Merkel cell carcinoma, clear margins, no extracapsular extension

cancer_timeline.value: Wide local excision and axillary node dissection
CT chest/abdomen/pelvis shows no evidence of distant metastases

patient_facts.value: Surgical site healed well with good cosmetic outcome
No clinical evidence of local recurrence or new nodal disease
Blood tests show stable biochemistry and adequate haematological parameters

status_updates.value: Merkel cell carcinoma of right forearm with nodal involvement, post-surgery, receiving adjuvant Avelumab with good tolerance and no evidence of recurrence
Grade 1 fatigue only, no immune-related adverse events
Review in 2 weeks prior to cycle 5
